intro: Sisyrinchium biforme, commonly known as the two-lobed blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like leaves and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Its flowers are bilaterally symmetrical and have a distinctive two-lobed structure at the base. Sisyrinchium biforme is often found in dry environments and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
